definition: (of a wife) to return to her parental home/(fig.) to return to one's old place, job, school etc
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A: My wife has been gone for two weeks visiting her mother.
sentences.chinese: 我妻子回娘家已经两个星期了。

sentences.english: My wife has been gone for two weeks visiting her mother.
sentences.chinese: 我妻子回娘家已经两个星期了。

sentences.english: Married women visit their side of the family.
sentences.chinese: 已婚妇女会回娘家拜访。

sentences.english: Big sister dont feel well want to return to fetus, season so often tried to comfort.
sentences.chinese: 大妹感觉不舒服想回娘家安胎，季常只好尽力安慰。

sentences.english: One day, YuLan her message, let her return home to have a look.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，玉兰娘家捎信来，让她回娘家看看。
今天是个好机会，她回娘家。

definition: first return of bride to her parental home
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
(of a wife) to visit one's parental home
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
